Description: Painted terracotta shabti of a man named Bakkhons, with a black lappet-wig(worn), a yellow modelled face with a "goatee" beard, a black collar and crossed yellow hands holding red hoes; the leg section is inscribed with six rows of Hieroglyphic text; two yellow seed-baskets at the back on either side of a vertical column of text.
Curator's comments: The collection contains two other shabtis of the same man (EA 71201 and 71203; on EA 71201 he is also called Bakenkhons).
